TITLE: A simple testing board
DESCRIPTION: The first board ever made, it was made for testing but it ended up being kept here because of love and so that I could also test this. it was updated so it could also be used in modern Unnio.

TITLE: The shared template
DESCRIPTION:
This template is meant to be shared between programming, art and design and it also comes with an urgent and in progress stacks and it automates the status and the colour of nodes base on what stack you add it to. 

The name of the stakcs do relate to the status that stack will set except for the programming, art and design but they will all set the status to "to be done".

TITLE: The personal template
DESCRIPTION:
This template is not meant to be used by more than one as it is designed to help one with there own personal goals towards a project. It automates the status and the colour of nodes base on what stack you add it to. 

The name of the stacks do relate to the status that stack will set, and there is one node that demonstrates the behaviour of the Inactive stack.

TITLE: TTD style board
DESCRIPTION:
This board is a great utility for those who used test driven development as it can provide a great visual understanding of the tasks that need made and the conditions required to satisfy them. 

This board also comes with automatic colour and state changing but it can also alert you to if you placed a node in the wrong place.

TITLE: TTD style board but it cant show you placement errors
DESCRIPTION:
This board is a great utility for those who used test driven development as it can provide a great visual understanding of the tasks that need made and the conditions required to satisfy them. 

This board also comes with automatic colour and state changing but it can NOT alert you to if you placed a node in the wrong place.

TITLE: The reliability board
DESCRIPTION: A simple board that shows most of the normal stages a section of code would go though. This board only dose automatic colours and statuses.

TITLE: The mesh creation board
DESCRIPTION:
This board is great at planning out the process for making meshes, and it is also good at tracking the progress of multiple meshs and how complete they are are.

 This board features automatic node colouring and status setting as well as placement error indication.

TITLE: how to make stacks and nodes
DESCRIPTION: The first tutorial board ever made, this boards was made to display how one would go about making a board in the Unnio tutorial window.

TITLE: The conditions tutorial board
DESCRIPTION: This was the board used in the production of the node conditions tutorial. It was was used to teach how one could make nodes move around by them selfs.

TITLE: The stack tutorial board
DESCRIPTION: This was the board used in the production of the node stack actions tutorial. It can be a very useful insight as to how stacks work.

TITLE: The masterful stack challenge
DESCRIPTION: A board that sets the colour of a node to something like yellow if it is dragged into a stack it dose not belong to.
